channel.title: Disturbing games
channel.description:
Which games have you played that have scenes that disturbed you in some way?
For me:
Silent Hill 2 - what a freaky game. The creatures you encounter can be really disturbing to look at.
Dead Space - that place where you find huge vats full of human fetuses. It gave me the creeps the first time I saw that.
Penumbra/Amnesia - those games are completely built around the disturbing and creepy factor.

item.title: Disturbing games
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
DISTRUBING - Amnesia

SCARY - Penumbra

Notice, in horror games that novelty is paramount. You really can’t replay a horror game and get the same jolt you did the first time.

Read full topic

item.title: Disturbing games
item.dc:creator: nevad
item.description:
OrderOfDagon:

In Silent Hill 2 the mannequins actually do attack you… Haha, ironic…

Yeah, I’m familiar with that Although this guy was kinda more disturbing - https://images.wikia.com/silent/images/6/67/LyingFigure.png
The mannequins were easy to run around and ignore them tbh
I forgot to mention The Thing. Played it for the first time when I was 11… I think. The moments when your teammate turns into a monster and the monsters themselves were kinda… Disturbing.

Read full topic

item.title: Disturbing games
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
Maxey:

Try Alien vs Predator 2000 as a Marine.

fuck YES. That game is the scariest avp game, and possibly one of the scariest game’s ever made when you play as a marine.

Most games barely scare me, but i always get scared the f*** out of playing that. It’s especially fun when you show it to a friend who thinks he tough shit

Read full topic

item.title: Disturbing games
item.dc:creator: Morpheon
item.description:
The creepy mansion level in Super Mario 64, damn I used to be so freaked out by the music and the ambience when I was 10. Not to mention that asshole piano that would try to bite you whenever you came within 5 feet of it.

Read full topic

item.title: Disturbing games
item.dc:creator: eharsh87
item.description:
Don’t know if these games’ll interest anyone here, but the Yume Nikki series, and LSD: Dream Simulator are two of the most distressing games I’ve ever played.

Yume Nikki is an RPG Maker game (but not an RPG, oddly) based on a dream journal (actually, the title directly translates to dream journal, so…). The entire gameplay of the game is spent exploring the dreamscapes of the main character. It varies from slightly odd to actually pretty disturbing. The fan sequels are supposedly much worse in the distrubing content category, though.

LSD is a first person game for the original PlayStation and is similar to Yume Nikki except it’s much more random while YN is a bit more scripted and not as dynamic. (No, it’s not a drug reference. The developers claim it stands for Lovely Sweet Dream.)

Also, the white chamber. Kind of like Event Horizon, insofar as it’s set in space and hellish things happen.

And the Chzo Mythos (5 Days a Stranger, 7 Days a Skeptic, Trilby’s Notes, and 6 Days a Sacrifice), by Yahtzee, back before he sold his soul to the Escapist. (I was a Yahtzee fan before it was cool to be a Yahtzee fan. Anyone else remember Yahtzee Takes on the World?) First horror games I played, and they still get under my skin today. Keep in mind I was like. …13 when I would have first played 5 days. It fucked me up for a while.

Read full topic
